intro: Collinsia corymbosa, commonly known as the showy blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open woodlands and meadows. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of flowers in the spring. Collinsia corymbosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
